content:
We've got some sprints coming up soon and could use some help triaging the "Good First Issue" label in the issue queue. Help in the following ways:

1) Add this label to issues that might be a good first issue if they don't have the label already.
2) Remove it from issues if it doesn't belong.
3) Maybe add some helpful text about how a new Backdrop CMS contributor might be able to help with an issue with that label. Example, what part of the issue is good for a beginner.
NOTE: Good first issues are issues that a user might see some significant progress on in one day (maybe even an hour or two).

Here is a list of the current "Good First Issues." https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

@StPaulTim There you go: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4635 Just created this issue and thought of you and your upcoming sprints :wink:

hook_taxonomy_term_page_alter() isn't documented 路 Issue #4635 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Line 69 of taxonomy.pages.inc has this: backdrop_alter('taxonomy_term_page', $build); This means that you can implement hook_taxonomy_term_page_alter(), however that hook isn't document...
